title: >>> DARK, DAZED, and Confused
body_text:
The Eras of Dodgeball
The Beginning
: Events 1 to X
The New Generation
: Events XONE to 15
The Transitional Era
: Events X6 to 20
The Ice Age
: Events 21 to 29
The Evolutionary Epoch
: Events 30 to 39
The Populous Wars
: Events XL to 42
Life in the Twenties
: Events 43 to 49
The Dogs Days
: Events 50 to 53
........
It's rather obvious why dodgeball has entered the so-called
Dark Days
. Perhaps more accurately, the era would be better off being named the
Dark Daze
, as mystery and confusion continue haunt players.
It was looking as if the days without light were to be put behind. But not even a maintainance and grounds person knew what he was talking about. The
Dark Days
continue to move forward. Is there is a light, literally and figuratively, at the end of this tunnel?
DODGEBALL LXI Rematch
Diana DiBuccio vs. Kerrin Marchese II
"I've seen wars between small countries with less intensity," as the great WWE announcer Jim Ross remarked some eons ago. But the statement is indeed true as female titans Diana DiBuccio and Kerrin Marchese squared-off in a rematch from there heated battle seven events earlier. In a rare occurance, the match ended in a 5 to 5 tie.
Leading into DODGEBALL 68, it was shockingly announced that Kerrin would likely be making her final appearance as a dodgeball competitor. And really, what better way to go out than with a captains victory over the woman who has seen and done it all, the loud-mouthed Diana DiBuccio.
Both teams were comprised of some of the most recognized athletes to ever set foot on the dodgeball court. With the return of
Prison Ball
, it was inevitable that intensity and injuries would be at an all-time high.
In what was a fantastic, fast-paced matchup, a departing legend Kerrin Marchese came up short in her quest to defeat icon Diana DiBuccio. It was a crushing win for Diana: 6 to 2.
DAZED and CONFUSED
What a sadistic massacre DODGEBALL 68 turned out to be. Faceshots galore and even a new victim of the dreaded finger injuries caused plenty of pain and suffering for the 18 elitest.
Chris Adams was nailed in the face not once but twice, feeling the effects of both a bulletball and painball. Both times his glasses were completely knocked off his face, causing a delay of game as he was forced to find the pieces and put them back together. Thankfully, he suffered no serious bodily harm.
Lauren Stopa gave us the scare of the night. As the high-flyin' Derek Carty dodged a bullet from Mike "Sputz", Lauren was met with the bulletball instead, sending the female titan off to the sidelines instantly. It was thought her finger to be broken, or at the least dislocated. It is currently unknown what the effects of such a hit have caused, but Lauren is wished the best of luck.
Melissa Kerr and Sascha Basista were also on the receiving end of a dreaded faceshot. Neither of them were injured thankfully, and continued to compete throughout DODGEBALL 68.
RECORDS
- Attendance: 18
- Biggest Return: Matt Larsen (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LVII)
- Perhaps the most rare bit of info concerning DODGEBALL 68 is that there was no poster.
-
Dark Dodgeball
: 5 event in a row. Despite reports of the lights staying on until 9:30, they went off at 8.
- Kerrin Marchese made what is believed to be her final dodgeball appearance as she is transferring to Towson University in Maryland. Unfortunately, Kerrin suffered her first loss, with a current record of 0-1-1.
- After defeating Kerrin, Diana DiBuccio's record has improved to 2-2-2. This marked Diana's sixth time as captain, tying the female record with Sara DeCuir.
- Popular pizza-man Luke delivered a nice free pizza.
- If Lauren Stopa did indeed break her finger, she would be the fifth person on the unlucky list following Chris Burke, Dan Spengeman, Mike "Sputz", and Diana DiBuccio.
DODGEBALL 69 and DODGEBALL 70
Why lays ahead couldn't get any bigger.
-- The forthcoming event, DODGEABLL 69, is headlined by an incredible three-peat matchup, featuring the sisters Winston. They were captains at DODGEBALL DAY 1 and at the OYA (DODGEBALL 54), both times Valerie coming out victorious. Will this be Lauren's time to shine or will Valerie keep her unbeaten record? It's the "Winston Cup III" and you can bet that anything and everything will happen. Do not miss the Christmas spectacular known as DODGEBALL 69.
DODGEBALL 69: Saturday, December 23rd.
-- And then the big one, DODGEBALL 70. The seventh ten event falls on the same day as the 2005 DODGEBALL 20; a true milestone event. The same success looks to be duplicated despite current light failure, and an aging sport altogether. But fear not as you never know what to expect at the anticipated ten events. They have brought only the best. As of the now, the captains confrontation is "Legend vs. Legend": Chris Adams against Kevin Megill for the first time ever. This match is currently unofficial, but as of now is it your DODGEBALL 70 main event.
And as for the light failure, say "no more"! At DODGEBALL 70,
the dodgeball writer is asking for your help
. The end of 2006 is near and what better way to go out than surrounded by light. The goal at DODGEBALL 70, aside from a physical match, is to make the event as bright as possible with Christmas lights!
If you or anyone you know has any unused / extra Christmas lights, ask to borrow them as the main decorations at the 70th dodgeball extravaganza will see the courts encircled by lights of all colors.
DODGEBALL 70: Saturday, December 30th.
-- Special Start time of 6pm!
body_html:
The Eras of Dodgeball
The Beginning: Events 1 to X
The New Generation: Events XONE to 15
The Transitional Era: Events X6 to 20
The Ice Age: Events 21 to 29
The Evolutionary Epoch: Events 30 to 39
The Populous Wars: Events XL to 42
Life in the Twenties: Events 43 to 49
The Dogs Days: Events 50 to 53

........

It's rather obvious why dodgeball has entered the so-called Dark Days. Perhaps more accurately, the era would be better off being named the Dark Daze, as mystery and confusion continue haunt players.

It was looking as if the days without light were to be put behind. But not even a maintainance and grounds person knew what he was talking about. The Dark Days continue to move forward. Is there is a light, literally and figuratively, at the end of this tunnel?

DODGEBALL LXI Rematch
Diana DiBuccio vs. Kerrin Marchese II

"I've seen wars between small countries with less intensity," as the great WWE announcer Jim Ross remarked some eons ago. But the statement is indeed true as female titans Diana DiBuccio and Kerrin Marchese squared-off in a rematch from there heated battle seven events earlier. In a rare occurance, the match ended in a 5 to 5 tie.

Leading into DODGEBALL 68, it was shockingly announced that Kerrin would likely be making her final appearance as a dodgeball competitor. And really, what better way to go out than with a captains victory over the woman who has seen and done it all, the loud-mouthed Diana DiBuccio.

Both teams were comprised of some of the most recognized athletes to ever set foot on the dodgeball court. With the return of Prison Ball, it was inevitable that intensity and injuries would be at an all-time high.

In what was a fantastic, fast-paced matchup, a departing legend Kerrin Marchese came up short in her quest to defeat icon Diana DiBuccio. It was a crushing win for Diana: 6 to 2.

DAZED and CONFUSED

What a sadistic massacre DODGEBALL 68 turned out to be. Faceshots galore and even a new victim of the dreaded finger injuries caused plenty of pain and suffering for the 18 elitest.

Chris Adams was nailed in the face not once but twice, feeling the effects of both a bulletball and painball. Both times his glasses were completely knocked off his face, causing a delay of game as he was forced to find the pieces and put them back together. Thankfully, he suffered no serious bodily harm.

Lauren Stopa gave us the scare of the night. As the high-flyin' Derek Carty dodged a bullet from Mike "Sputz", Lauren was met with the bulletball instead, sending the female titan off to the sidelines instantly. It was thought her finger to be broken, or at the least dislocated. It is currently unknown what the effects of such a hit have caused, but Lauren is wished the best of luck.

Melissa Kerr and Sascha Basista were also on the receiving end of a dreaded faceshot. Neither of them were injured thankfully, and continued to compete throughout DODGEBALL 68.

RECORDS

- Attendance: 18
- Biggest Return: Matt Larsen (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LVII)

- Perhaps the most rare bit of info concerning DODGEBALL 68 is that there was no poster.
- Dark Dodgeball: 5 event in a row. Despite reports of the lights staying on until 9:30, they went off at 8.
- Kerrin Marchese made what is believed to be her final dodgeball appearance as she is transferring to Towson University in Maryland. Unfortunately, Kerrin suffered her first loss, with a current record of 0-1-1.
- After defeating Kerrin, Diana DiBuccio's record has improved to 2-2-2. This marked Diana's sixth time as captain, tying the female record with Sara DeCuir.
- Popular pizza-man Luke delivered a nice free pizza.
- If Lauren Stopa did indeed break her finger, she would be the fifth person on the unlucky list following Chris Burke, Dan Spengeman, Mike "Sputz", and Diana DiBuccio.

DODGEBALL 69 and DODGEBALL 70

Why lays ahead couldn't get any bigger.

-- The forthcoming event, DODGEABLL 69, is headlined by an incredible three-peat matchup, featuring the sisters Winston. They were captains at DODGEBALL DAY 1 and at the OYA (DODGEBALL 54), both times Valerie coming out victorious. Will this be Lauren's time to shine or will Valerie keep her unbeaten record? It's the "Winston Cup III" and you can bet that anything and everything will happen. Do not miss the Christmas spectacular known as DODGEBALL 69.

DODGEBALL 69: Saturday, December 23rd.

-- And then the big one, DODGEBALL 70. The seventh ten event falls on the same day as the 2005 DODGEBALL 20; a true milestone event. The same success looks to be duplicated despite current light failure, and an aging sport altogether. But fear not as you never know what to expect at the anticipated ten events. They have brought only the best. As of the now, the captains confrontation is "Legend vs. Legend": Chris Adams against Kevin Megill for the first time ever. This match is currently unofficial, but as of now is it your DODGEBALL 70 main event.

And as for the light failure, say "no more"! At DODGEBALL 70, the dodgeball writer is asking for your help. The end of 2006 is near and what better way to go out than surrounded by light. The goal at DODGEBALL 70, aside from a physical match, is to make the event as bright as possible with Christmas lights! If you or anyone you know has any unused / extra Christmas lights, ask to borrow them as the main decorations at the 70th dodgeball extravaganza will see the courts encircled by lights of all colors.

DODGEBALL 70: Saturday, December 30th.
-- Special Start time of 6pm!
